P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 and (b) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life anywhere other than Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life on Europa. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa prior to anywhere else, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

### P: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This question is highly relevant given the current political landscape and the prominence of the Trump family within the Republican Party. The probability estimate will take into account factors such as public opinion, polling data, and the political environment leading up to the election. Given the family's strong political brand, I estimate a probability of 0.65 that at least one family member will secure the nomination.

### not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This is the complementary event of P. If P is estimated at 0.65, not_P would naturally be 0.35. This is a straightforward calculation based on the principle of complementary probabilities.

### para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
This question essentially rephrases P and should have the same probability estimate. Therefore, I assign para_P a probability of 0.65.

### Q: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Global warming is a pressing issue, and various scientific studies indicate a significant likelihood of surpassing this threshold by 2100. Taking into account current climate models and projections, I estimate a probability of 0.70 that this will occur.

### P_and_Q: Will both of the following occur: (1) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
The occurrence of both events is less likely than either occurring individually. Assuming some level of independence between the two events, I estimate this joint probability at 0.30.

### P_or_Q: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
This question encompasses a broader range of outcomes. Using the formula for the union of two events, I estimate this probability at 0.85, reflecting the high likelihood of at least one of these significant events occurring.

### Q_and_not_P: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This event combines a certainty about global warming with the uncertainty of the Trump family candidacy. Given the estimates, I suggest a probability of 0.20.

### Q_given_P: Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
This conditional question assumes the occurrence of P. Given the high likelihood of global warming, I estimate this probability at 0.70.

### Consistency Rules
The estimates will be checked against the consistency rules provided:
1. **neg:** P = 1 - not_P

5. **but:** P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P
6. **cond:** P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P
7. **para:** P = para_P

Each of these rules will be evaluated to ensure the estimates are mathematically sound and logically consistent.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

In this set of predictions, we are evaluating the likelihood of a member of the Trump family being the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, the possibility of at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and the relationships between these two events. 

**P: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?**
This question is likely to receive a moderate probability estimate. Given the prominence of Donald Trump and his family's continued involvement in politics, there's a reasonable chance that one of them will be nominated. However, the political landscape can be unpredictable, leading to a probability estimate of around 0.60.

**not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?**
This is the complement of P and should therefore be estimated as 1 - P. If we estimate P at 0.60, then not_P would be 0.40. This relationship directly follows the negation rule.

**para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?**
This is essentially the same question as P, so the probability estimate should be the same, around 0.60.

**Q: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?**
This question is more uncertain due to the complexities of climate change predictions. However, given current trends and scientific consensus, I would estimate this probability at around 0.70, reflecting a strong likelihood of significant warming.

**P_and_Q: Will both of the following occur: (1) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?**
This question requires both P and Q to be true. Assuming P and Q are independent, we can estimate this as P * Q = 0.60 * 0.70 = 0.42.

**P_or_Q: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?**
Using the formula for the union of two independent events, this can be estimated as P + Q - P_and_Q = 0.60 + 0.70 - 0.42 = 0.88.

**Q_and_not_P: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?**
This scenario requires Q to be true while P is false. Assuming independence, it can be estimated as Q * not_P = 0.70 * 0.40 = 0.28.

**Q_given_P: Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?**
This is a conditional probability. If we assume that the nomination does not significantly affect climate predictions, we can estimate this as similar to Q, around 0.70. 

Overall, the relationships between these events show how political dynamics and environmental issues can intersect, but they are also distinct enough to allow for independent probability assessments. Each estimate needs to conform to the consistency rules outlined, ensuring that the relationships among these probabilities are mathematically valid.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070 and will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes never fall below 75 years before 2040?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
   a. Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
   b. Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. At no time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

**para_P**: Similar to P, this question asks if it is possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination. Since P has a high probability, para_P will also be high, reflecting the likelihood of P being true. 

**Q**: This question concerns global warming and its likelihood of reaching at least 2˚C by 2100. Given current climate trends and scientific predictions, I estimate this probability to be moderate to high, as many studies suggest we are on track for significant warming. 

**P_and_Q**: This question combines both events, requiring both P and Q to be true. The joint probability will depend on the individual probabilities of P and Q, and I expect it to be lower than either P or Q alone. 

**P_or_Q**: This question resolves positively if either P or Q is true. Given that both events are relatively likely, I expect this probability to be higher than the individual probabilities of P and Q. 

**Q_and_not_P**: This question looks at the scenario where global warming occurs while no Trump family member is nominated. The probability here will depend on the independence of these events, and I expect it to be lower due to the potential overlap of political and environmental issues. 

**Q_given_P**: This conditional probability assesses the likelihood of Q given that P is true. Given that political decisions can impact climate policies, I would expect this to be moderately high, but still lower than Q alone.

In summary, the relationships among these questions are interconnected, particularly between P and Q. The predictions must respect the consistency rules, ensuring that the probabilities align correctly with each other.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

P.title: Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

For the current set of questions, I will analyze the probabilities of events related to the Trump family potentially being the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and the likelihood of at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100. 

### P: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
Given the political landscape, Donald Trump remains a prominent figure in the Republican Party. His previous candidacy and ongoing influence suggest a higher probability that a Trump family member could be the nominee. I estimate this probability to be relatively high, around 0.65.

### not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This is the complementary event to P. If I estimate P at 0.65, then not_P should be 1 - P, which is 0.35.

### para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
This event is similar to P, as it also revolves around the possibility of a Trump family member being nominated. Therefore, I can assign it the same probability as P, which is 0.65.

### Q: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Climate change is a significant concern, and based on current trends and scientific predictions, the likelihood of exceeding 2˚C of warming by 2100 is substantial. I estimate this probability to be around 0.70.

### P_and_Q: Will both of the following occur: (1) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
The occurrence of both events is likely but not guaranteed. Assuming independence, I can estimate this probability as P * Q = 0.65 * 0.70 = 0.455.

### P_or_Q: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
This is the union of the two events. Using the formula for the probability of the union of two events, P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q = 0.65 + 0.70 - 0.455 = 0.895.

### Q_and_not_P: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This event considers the intersection of Q and not_P. Assuming independence, I estimate this probability as Q * not_P = 0.70 * 0.35 = 0.245.

### Q_given_P: Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
This conditional probability can be assumed to remain similar to the original estimate of Q, as the nomination does not inherently affect climate outcomes. Therefore, I estimate this probability at 0.70.

### Summary
- P: 0.65
- not_P: 0.35
- para_P: 0.65
- Q: 0.70
- P_and_Q: 0.455
- P_or_Q: 0.895
- Q_and_not_P: 0.245
- Q_given_P: 0.70

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The USA enters a second civil war before 2031 (b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The USA enters a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
(b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is never a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, or (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will NASA return a sample of material from the surface of Mars to Earth before SpaceX Starship lands on Mars, and will Starlink not conduct an IPO before 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The resolution of this question depends on the relative timing of three events:
1) A mission substantially (>30%) or wholly funded by NASA successfully returns a sample from the surface of Mars to Earth.
2) A rocket built by SpaceX designated as "Starship" or clearly designated as a successor to Starship successfully lands on Mars.
3) Starlink conducts an IPO.
The question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
- Event 1) happens before event 2).
- Event 3) does not happen before 2030-01-01 00:00 UTC.
The question will resolve negatively if either of the following conditions is met:
- Event 2) happens before event 1).
- Event 3) happens before 2030-01-01 00:00 UTC.
If neither of these events happens before the closing date (2035) the question will resolve ambiguously.
Note that the following series of events would result in a negative resolution: SpaceX builds a Starship rocket which is purchased by NASA. That rocket lands on Mars successfully. That rocket returns to Earth with samples from Mars in it. Because the SpaceX Starship landed on Mars before the NASA mission returned samples to Earth, the question resolves negative.
Similarly, the following sequence of events would resolve positive: NASA contracts a Falcon Heavy from SpaceX for one of its missions. That mission successfully returns samples to Earth before Starship lands on Mars.
It is also worth noting that if both NASA and SpaceX hew to their currently claimed timelines, Starship will land on Mars in 2026, 4 years before a sample return mission is completed in 2030.

The IPO event will be judged according to reports in the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, New York Times or Washington Post posted to the discussion below.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Starlink conduct an IPO before 2030? (b) NASA return a sample of material from the surface of Mars to Earth before SpaceX Starship lands on Mars?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
(a) This will be judged according to reports in the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, New York Times or Washington Post posted to the discussion below. If Starlink does not go public by 2030-01-01 00:00 UTC, the question resolves negatively.
(b) The resolution of this question depends on the relative timing of two events:
1) A mission substantially (>30%) or wholly funded by NASA successfully returns a sample from the surface of Mars to Earth.
2) A rocket built by SpaceX designated as "Starship" or clearly designated as a successor to Starship successfully lands on Mars.
The question will resolve positive if event 1) happens before event 2).
The question will resolve negatively if event 2) happens before event 1).
If neither of these events happens before the closing date (2035) the question will resolve ambiguously.
Note that the following series of events would result in a negative resolution: SpaceX builds a Starship rocket which is purchased by NASA. That rocket lands on Mars successfully. That rocket returns to Earth with samples from Mars in it. Because the SpaceX Starship landed on Mars before the NASA mission returned samples to Earth, the question resolves negative.
Similarly, the following sequence of events would resolve positive: NASA contracts a Falcon Heavy from SpaceX for one of its missions. That mission successfully returns samples to Earth before Starship lands on Mars.
It is also worth noting that if both NASA and SpaceX hew to their currently claimed timelines, Starship will land on Mars in 2026, 4 years before a sample return mission is completed in 2030.

P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civillians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1 .
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

1. **P (Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: Given the current political climate, Donald Trump has a significant chance of being the nominee again, given his strong backing within the Republican party. Other family members also have a possibility, but they are less prominent. Therefore, I estimate this probability to be moderately high.

2. **not_P (Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: This is the direct negation of P. If P is high, not_P must be low. Given my estimation of P, not_P will be correspondingly low.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: This question is essentially about the possibility of P occurring, and since P is estimated to be high, para_P will also be high.

4. **Q (Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?)**: This is a more complex question, influenced by various factors including climate policies and scientific predictions. Given the current trajectory of climate change and the scientific consensus, I estimate this probability to be moderate.

5. **P_and_Q (Will both of the following occur: (1) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?)**: This combines the two probabilities, and since both P and Q have a reasonable chance of occurring, I estimate this probability to be lower than either P or Q individually but still significant.

6. **P_or_Q (Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?)**: This probability should be higher than both P and Q individually, as it allows for either event to occur.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: This is a combination of two events that could happen simultaneously, but since not_P is likely low (due to P being high), this probability will also be low.

8. **Q_given_P (Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?)**: This conditional probability considers the scenario where P is true. It is likely that climate change is an ongoing issue regardless of the political context, so I estimate this probability to be moderate.

In summary, the estimates will reflect the interdependencies between these questions while ensuring that they adhere to the consistency rules provided.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050 and (b) there be no "World War Three" before 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.
(b) At no time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
- There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
- At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1.
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur by 2050: (a) a "World War Three" or (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hitting $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs by January 1, 2050:
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by January 1, 2050, 00:00 UTC.

Fine Print
For condition (a), PPP may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA

For condition (b), this question resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.
